meanings.sent1: The objectionableness of the movie's content led to its ban in several countries.
meanings.sent2: Her behavior had a level of objectionableness that made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The objectionableness of the situation was so extreme that it almost seemed like a scene from a comedy.
meanings.sent4: The objectionableness of his actions cast a dark shadow over the entire event.
meanings.sent5: The objectionableness of the smell was so overpowering that it lingered for days.

meanings.definition: The state of being offensive or disagreeable.
meanings.sent1: The objectionableness of his remarks caused a heated argument among the group.
meanings.sent2: The objectionableness of the taste made it hard for anyone to enjoy the dish.
meanings.sent3: Despite his objectionableness, he always managed to make people laugh with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The objectionableness of the graffiti on the wall was a stark reminder of the city's struggles.
meanings.sent5: The objectionableness of the noise outside was like a constant drumbeat in her ears.
